title: How Road Accident Fund cases are crippling the Gauteng High Court
body: Hundreds of Road Accident Fund cases are clogging the court roll in Gauteng and lawyers say the organisation is not making enough effort to ensure cases are finalised quickly.

title: DA calls for Minister Creecy’s intervention as Road Accident Fund faces collapse
body: The DA wrote to the Minister of Transport, Barbara Creecy, to urgently draw her attention to the fact that the Road Accident Fund (RAF) seems to have halted payments for nearly four months.This state of affairs seems to point to the fund’s imminent implosion without prompt intervention from either the Transport Minister or the Portfolio Committee on Transport.

title: Attorneys not to blame for Road Accident Fund’s woes
body: The statement made by Mr Polela (Road Accident Fund spokesperson) cannot go unchallenged. The RAF’s dire situation cannot be laid at the door of attorneys.

title: RAF reports R45.1bn claims have been paid out
body: The Road Accident Fund (RAF) has paid out R45,1bn in claims in the 2023/24 financial year with the majority of the payouts going to victims who could not return to work after car accidents.
